intro: Pericallis multiflora, commonly known as the mountain heath, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes shrubs and small trees adapted to acidic soils. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Pericallis multiflora thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Its dense foliage and ornamental flowers make it a valued species in horticulture.
